description: World's leading software development platform with Git version control
long_description: GitHub is a development platform inspired by the way you work. From open source to business, you can host and review code, manage projects, and build software alongside 50 million developers.
features: Git repositories, Issue tracking, Pull requests, Actions CI/CD, Code review
pros_cons: PROS: Free for public repos, excellent collaboration tools, huge ecosystem CONS: Can be complex for beginners, private repos require paid plans
use_cases: Perfect for software development teams, open source projects, and code collaboration

description: Collaborative interface design tool for teams
long_description: Figma is a vector graphics editor and prototyping tool which is primarily web-based, with additional offline features enabled by desktop applications.
features: Vector design, Prototyping, Real-time collaboration, Component libraries, Developer handoff
pros_cons: PROS: Real-time collaboration, cross-platform, great prototyping CONS: Requires internet connection, can be slow with large files
use_cases: UI/UX design, prototyping, design systems, team collaboration

description: All-in-one workspace for notes, tasks, wikis, and databases
long_description: Notion is a collaboration platform with modified Markdown support that integrates kanban boards, tasks, wikis and databases.
features: Note-taking, Task management, Databases, Templates, Team collaboration
pros_cons: PROS: Highly customizable, great for documentation, powerful database features CONS: Can be overwhelming, steep learning curve
use_cases: Project management, documentation, note-taking, team wikis

features: Channels, Direct messaging, File sharing, App integrations, Video calls
pros_cons: PROS: Great integrations, organized conversations, searchable history CONS: Can be noisy, expensive for large teams
use_cases: Team communication, project coordination, remote work collaboration

description: Frontend deployment platform with zero configuration
long_description: Vercel is a cloud platform for static sites and Serverless Functions that fits perfectly with your workflow. It enables developers to host websites and web services that deploy instantly, scale automatically, and require no supervision.
features: Instant deployments, Automatic SSL, Edge Network, Preview deployments, Analytics
pros_cons: PROS: Zero configuration, excellent performance, great DX CONS: Can get expensive at scale, vendor lock-in
use_cases: Static sites, Next.js apps, serverless functions, preview environments

description: Complete payments platform for the internet
long_description: Stripe is a technology company that builds economic infrastructure for the internet. Businesses of every size use Stripe's software to accept payments and manage their businesses online.
features: Payment processing, Subscriptions, Invoicing, Fraud prevention, Global payments
pros_cons: PROS: Easy integration, excellent documentation, powerful API CONS: Transaction fees add up, complex pricing for edge cases
use_cases: SaaS billing, e-commerce payments, subscription management, marketplace transactions

description: AI research and deployment company with powerful APIs
long_description: OpenAI provides access to powerful AI models including GPT-4, DALL-E, and Whisper through simple APIs. Build AI-powered applications with state-of-the-art language models.
features: GPT models, Image generation, Speech-to-text, Embeddings, Fine-tuning
pros_cons: PROS: State-of-the-art models, easy API, great docs CONS: Can be expensive, rate limits, API changes
use_cases: Chatbots, content generation, code assistance, text analysis, image generation

description: Open source Firebase alternative with PostgreSQL
long_description: Supabase is an open source Firebase alternative. It provides a Postgres database, authentication, instant APIs, edge functions, realtime subscriptions, and storage.
features: PostgreSQL database, Authentication, Realtime subscriptions, Storage, Edge functions
pros_cons: PROS: Open source, SQL database, generous free tier CONS: Newer platform, smaller community than Firebase
use_cases: Web applications, mobile backends, realtime apps, user authentication

description: Utility-first CSS framework for rapid UI development
long_description: Tailwind CSS is a utility-first CSS framework packed with classes that can be composed to build any design, directly in your markup.
features: Utility classes, Responsive design, Dark mode, Custom themes, JIT compiler
pros_cons: PROS: Fast development, consistent design, great documentation CONS: HTML can get verbose, learning curve for utility-first approach
use_cases: Web application styling, rapid prototyping, design systems, responsive layouts

long_description: Resend is the email platform for developers. Send transactional and marketing emails with a simple API and beautiful React email templates.
features: Email API, React email templates, Webhooks, Analytics, Domain authentication
pros_cons: PROS: Developer-friendly, React templates, generous free tier CONS: Newer service, limited integrations compared to SendGrid
use_cases: Transactional emails, password resets, notifications, newsletters
